content.question: In the words Sermonem . . . Teucri (lines 5-7), Jupiter tells Juno that

choices.label: the Ausonians, though mixed together with Trojans, will maintain their own customs and language
Trojan culture will eventually dominate Ausonian culture
the two peoples will mix equally and will speak a new language that is neither Ausonian nor Trojan
the Ausonians and Trojans will live apart from each other and will retain their separate identities

content.answer: the Ausonians, though mixed together with Trojans, will maintain their own customs and language

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
